Indicator Name: Cost of an energy sufficient diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive starchy staple for energy balance, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day, for a representative person at 2330 kcal/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Cost of a nutrient adequate diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally-available foods for nutrient adequacy, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day, for a representative person within upper and lower bounds for 23 essential macro- and micronutrients plus energy balance at 2330 kcal/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Cost of a healthy diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally-available foods to meet requirements for food-based dietary guidelines, in current PPP dollar/person/day, for a representative person within energy balance at 2330 kcal/day. Data available for 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020. PPPs for 2018 and/or 2019 and/or 2020 are imputed by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations when not available in the World Development Indicators database, for the given countries of Angola, Aruba, Belize, Bermuda, Cayman Islands, Curaçao, British Virgin Islands, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Eswatini, Ethiopia, Guinea-Bissau, Iran (Islamic Republic of), Liberia, Myanmar, Niger, Nigeria, Sao Tome and Principe, Sint Maarten, Suriname and Tajikistan.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of a healthy diet relative to the cost of sufficient energy from starchy staples
Long definition: Ratio between the cost of a healthy diet (CoHD) that meets food-based dietary guidelines and the cost of caloric adequacy (CoCA) that uses only starchy staples to meet energy requirements. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of fruits
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally-available fruits needed to meet intake levels recommended in food-based dietary guidelines, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of vegetables
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally-available vegetables needed to meet intake levels recommended in food-based dietary guidelines, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of starchy staples
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally-available starchy staples needed to meet intake levels recommended in food-based dietary guidelines, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of animal-source foods
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally-available animal sourced foods needed to meet intake levels recommended in food-based dietary guidelines, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of legumes, nuts and seeds
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally available legumes, nuts or seeds needed to meet intake levels recommended in food-based dietary guidelines, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of oils and fats
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive locally available oils or fats needed to meet intake levels recommended in food-based dietary guidelines, in 2017 PPP dollar/person/day. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost share for fruits in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Share of costs for the least expensive fruits to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines, as a proportion of the total cost of a healthy diet. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost share for vegetables in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Share of costs for the least expensive vegetables to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines, as a proportion of the total cost of a healthy diet. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost share for starchy staples in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Share of costs for the least expensive starchy staples to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines, as a proportion of the total cost of a healthy diet. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost share for animal-sourced foods in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Share of costs for the least expensive animal-source foods to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines, as a proportion of the total cost of a healthy diet. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost share for legumes, nuts and seeds in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Share of costs for the least expensive legumes, nuts or seeds to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines, as a proportion of the total cost of a healthy diet. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost share for oils and fats in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Share of costs for the least expensive oils or fats to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines, as a proportion of the total cost of a healthy diet. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of fruits relative to the starchy staples in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive fruits as a multiple of the least expensive starchy staples to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of vegetables relative to the starchy staples in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive vegetables as a multiple of the least expensive starchy staples to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of animal-sourced foods relative to the starchy staples in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive animal-source foods as a multiple of the least expensive starchy staples to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of legumes, nuts and seeds relative to the starchy staples in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive legumes, nuts and seeds as a multiple of the least expensive starchy staples to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Cost of oils and fats relative to the starchy staples in a least-cost healthy diet
Long definition: Cost of the least expensive oils and fats as a multiple of the least expensive starchy staples to meet daily recommendations in food-based dietary guidelines. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Affordability of an energy sufficient diet: ratio of cost to the $0.99 food poverty line
Long definition: The ratio of the cost of an energy sufficient diet to the $0.99 food poverty line (52% of the international poverty line of 1.90/day in 2011 PPP dollars). Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Affordability of a nutrient adequate diet: ratio of cost to the $0.99 food poverty line
Long definition: The ratio of the cost of a nutrient adequate diet to the $0.99 food poverty line (52% of the international poverty line of 1.90/day in 2011 PPP dollars). Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Affordability of a healthy diet: ratio of cost to the $0.99 food poverty line
Long definition: The ratio of the cost of a healthy diet to the $0.99 food poverty line (52% of the international poverty line of 1.90/day in 2011 PPP dollars). Data available for 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Affordability of an energy sufficient diet: ratio of cost to food expenditures
Long definition: The ratio of the cost of an energy sufficient diet to total food expenditure per capita per day from national accounts. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Affordability of a nutrient adequate diet: ratio of cost to food expenditures
Long definition: The ratio of the cost of a nutrient adequate diet to total food expenditure per capita per day from national accounts. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Affordability of a healthy diet: ratio of cost to food expenditures
Long definition: The ratio of the cost of a healthy diet to total food expenditure per capita per day from national accounts. Data available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Indicator Name: Percent of the population who cannot afford sufficient calories at 52% of income
Long definition: The share of the population whose food budget is below the cost of an energy sufficient diet. The food budget is defined as 52% of household income, based on the average share of income that households in low-income countries spend on food. Income data are provided by the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Platform. A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level. Data are currently available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Percent of the population who cannot afford nutrient adequacy at 52% of income
Long definition: The share of the population whose food budget is below the cost of a nutrient adequate diet. The food budget is defined as 52% of household income, based on the average share of income that households in low-income countries spend on food. Income data are provided by the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Platform. A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level. Data are currently available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Indicator Name: Percent of the population who cannot afford a healthy diet at 52% of income
Long definition: The share of the population whose food budget is below the cost of a healthy diet. The food budget is defined as 52% of household income, based on the average share of income that households in low-income countries spend on food. Income data are provided by the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Platform. A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level. Data are currently available for 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.

Income data are provided by the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Platform. A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level. Data are currently available for 2017.
Source: Adapted from Herforth, A., Bai, Y., Venkat, A., Mahrt, K., Ebel, A. & Masters, W.A. 2020. Cost and affordability of healthy diets across and within countries. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Income data are provided by the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Platform. A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2020. FAO Agricultural Development Economics Technical Study No. 9. Rome, FAO. https://doi.org/10.4060/cb2431en

Long definition: The number of people whose food budget is below the cost of a healthy diet. The food budget is defined as 52% of household income, based on the average share of income that households in low-income countries spend on food. Income data are provided by the World Bank’s Poverty and Inequality Platform. A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level.
